title: Champion Mastery Identifying Roles
body: Hey guys, this is a minor issue, but after I played a game as mid lane assassin Wukong, The champion mastery listed my Wukong as a bruiser. I know that most people don't really care, but I would like to ask how exactly does the tracker track your role? For example, if I play AP Volibear mid, will I be marked as a mage or a bruiser?

replies.body: From what believe, the way that champion mastery  identifies your role on a specific character is from that champions primary role rather than what role you actually played in game.

Yup.
Even my games as Ashe are counted as ADC rather than Support. This is because you're not leveling your _playstyle_, but your _champion_ level.

>but I would like to ask how exactly does the tracker track your role?

It doesn't

It will track you going mid, that is all, you are still leveling the main role of the champion.

If I had to guess I'd say it uses the champions roles (as determined by Riot), in this case Wukong being a primary fighter and secondary tank. If you were to play AP Volibear mid it would probably come up as fighter or tank, the same as Wukong.
